Literature.Title: Synthesis and Functional Characterization of MAF-1A Peptide Derived From the Larvae of Housefly, Musca domestica (Diptera: Muscidae)
Literature.Author: Zhou J, Kong L, Fang N, Mao B, Ai H

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial and Anti-Inflammatory Activities of MAF-1-Derived Antimicrobial Peptide Mt6 and Its D-Enantiomer D-Mt6 against Acinetobacter baumannii by Targeting Cell Membranes and Lipopolysaccharide Interaction.
Literature.Author: Kong D, Hua X, Zhou R, Cui J, Wang T, Kong F, You HJ, Liu X, Adu-Amankwaah J, Guo G, Zheng K, Wu J, Tang R

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Rhizopus stolonifer(IC50=59.3µg/ml),Sclerotinia sclerotiorum(IC50=84.2µg/ml),Athelia rolfsii(IC50=144.9µg/ml),Thanatephorus cucumeris(IC50=48.5µg/ml),Human Influenza A Virus H1N1(40-50% Inhibition=50µg/ml),Human Influenza A Virus H1N1(70-80% Inhibition=100µg/ml),Candida albicans ATCC 10231(MIC=600µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=>1200µg/ml),Bacillus subtilis ATCC 6633(MIC=>1200µg/ml),Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=>1200µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 700603(MIC=>1200µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=>1200µg/ml),Acinetobacter baumannii ATCC 19606(MIC=>1200µg/ml)
